p: Ageratina altissima, white snakeroot (also known as Eupatorium rugosum), is an invasive plant in South Korea (Kil et al., 2004). White snakeroot is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States and Canada that is currently receiving much attention for its rapid invasion of Korean forests (Chun, Lee, & Lee, 2001; Lee, Han, Hong, & Choi, 2005). Populations of A. altissima are distributed in forest edges disturbed by the development of roads and human settlements from which the plant extends to inner forest patches, although individuals are scattered (Song, Hong, Kim, Byun, & Gin, 2005). Poisoning (milk sickness) in humans usually occurs following the consumption of milk or milk products from cows that consumed A. altissima (Davis et al., 2015 ).
